General Requirements.description: Conduct a comprehensive information technology audit for the Hazelwood School District (HSD).
General Requirements.details: The audit will collect and evaluate evidence of HSD’s information technology systems, practices, and operations to determine if changes are needed in the existing structure to meet current and future needs.

Proposals must be submitted through the District’s Vendor Registry online portal by 10:00 am on Tuesday, February 25, 2025.  Late or incorrect proposals will not be considered. The Hazelwood School District reserves the right to accept or reject any and all proposals. The Proposal Submission will represent the contractual agreement unless otherwise communicated.
Proposals must include HSD Form A – MBE/WBE Subcontractor Utilization Form, HSD Form B - MBE/WBE Subcontractor Solicitation Form, and Agreement for Contracted Services.
The District may award a contract based on initial proposals received, or may select a small number of companies for presentations/interviews at their own expense.

Companies can restrict the use and disclosure of specific data by marking the proposal transmittal letter with a designated statement. The District assumes no liability for disclosure or use of unmarked technical data.

The Vendor warrants that their software does not contain any disabling procedures (viruses, malware, etc.).  The vendor must notify the district immediately upon discovery of any such procedures and take action to remove them at their own expense.

Deliverables.details: The report should identify areas needing improvement and suggest changes to the existing IT structure to meet current and future needs.

Deliverables: Comprehensive audit report covering specified areas of the scope of work
A comprehensive written report detailing findings and recommendations
An executive summary for district leadership and school board
A presentation of findings to district leadership (and school board if required)
Prioritized recommendations that are broken into the areas covered in the scope of work
Suggested Key Performance Indicators (KPI) for measuring future success
Service Levels: Proposal to remain open for at least 90 days from the submission deadline
All proposals shall be deemed final, conclusive and irrevocable, and no proposal shall be subject to correction or amendment for any error or miscalculation
All proposals shall be considered valid for a minimum of 60 days
Performance Metrics: Effective and timely fulfillment of agreed-upon obligations
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for measuring future success (to be suggested by the firm)

Format.description: Proposals must be concise and organized, limited to 12 pages (excluding transmittal letter, executive summary, required attachments, and resumes).
Format.page_limit: 12 pages (excluding transmittal letter, executive summary, attachments, and resumes)

Format.description: Must include a transmittal letter introducing the company and expressing ability to meet RFP requirements, signed by a company officer.

Must include an executive summary (no more than 3 pages) briefly describing the company's approach, unmet requirements, and major proposal features.  Should clearly indicate how well the proposal meets the District's requirements.
Must include names, titles, and responsibilities of team members, indicating prior experience in school district IT audits if applicable.
Must provide the address of the office responsible for performing the work.
Must list personnel qualifications by discipline, indicating prior experience in school district IT audits if applicable.
Must provide a narrative explaining the company's qualifications for the project and unique benefits to the District.
Must list recent examples (last 5 years) of school information technology audit experience, including school district name, contact person, and phone number.
Must include references from other school districts (last 5 years) with contact person's name, address, and phone number.
Must indicate if the company (or members of a joint venture) has been involved in litigation related to professional services, providing details if applicable.
Must complete Attachment 2, "References and Experience," including all Missouri school districts served and similar projects, with completion years.

Scope of Work.description: A comprehensive audit including (but not limited to) the following areas. Proposals for all or specific items will be considered.  Firms must fill out the Bid Pricing sheet.

items.description: The contractor must provide services as defined in the scope of services section of the contract.

Proposer’s understanding of and ability to address the RFP requirements
Proposer’s experience and reference of similar sized school district clients
Proposer’s ability to provide the requested services
Project approach: Logical, organized, innovative understanding, and experience with similar projects

Financial Requirements.Invoice Submission: accountspayable@hazelwoodschools.org or 15955 New Halls Ferry Road, Florissant, MO 63031.  Include purchase order number, date of shipment, quantity, price, and item(s) shipped.
Financial Requirements.Price Increase: No increase in costs will be permitted during the term of the contract.
Financial Requirements.Taxes: Proposers shall NOT INCLUDE FEDERAL EXCISE TAX, TRANSPORTATION TAX, or STATE RETAIL SALES TAX in their cost proposal.
Financial Requirements.Contract Approval: Hazelwood School Board of Education approval anticipated within 60 days of submission.
Financial Requirements.Contract Execution: Vendor shall return properly executed contract copies and required certificates within seven (7) working days of receipt.

Insurance Requirements.Comprehensive General Liability: $1,000,000 per person per occurrence (Including Contractual Liability), $1,000,000 property damage per occurrence, $1,000,000 aggregate all claims per occurrence

Deliverables.Name: Current Technology Landscape Assessment
Deliverables.Description: Evaluate existing IT infrastructure, hardware, software, network capabilities; assess organizational effectiveness, application support, business continuity; assess classroom and administrative office technology integration; review special program technology needs

Deliverables.Name: Device Management and Refresh Planning
Deliverables.Description: Assess current device inventory and management; evaluate device refresh cycle and recommend improvements; analyze total cost of ownership (TCO); provide recommendations for a 4-year device refresh plan

Deliverables.Name: Infrastructure and Network Evaluation
Deliverables.Description: Assess current network infrastructure; evaluate bandwidth capacity and internet connectivity; review network security measures and data protection strategies; assess systems lifecycles, data management, system implementation, data loss prevention, data privacy, identity access management

Deliverables.Name: Professional Development and Training Assessment
Deliverables.Description: Review current technology-related professional development offerings; assess effectiveness of existing training programs; recommend improvements for ongoing coaching and support mechanisms

Deliverables.Name: Technical Support and Maintenance Evaluation
Deliverables.Description: Analyze current IT support structure and staffing levels; assess help desk operations and service delivery; evaluate existing maintenance and repair processes for devices

Deliverables.Name: Cybersecurity Readiness and Compliance Review
Deliverables.Description: Review for data security and compliance with FERPA and other state policies

Legal and Compliance Requirements.Confidentiality: Information furnished or disclosed under this RFP remains the property of the District.  Unless previously known, it shall be held in confidence and used only for the purposes of this RFP.
Legal and Compliance Requirements.Proprietary Information: Information furnished by interested parties to the District is not considered confidential or proprietary.
Legal and Compliance Requirements.District Policies: Successful Proposer shall follow all District policies, including those regarding confidentiality of student records.
Legal and Compliance Requirements.Permits and Fees: Vendor shall secure and pay for all permits and governmental fees.
Legal and Compliance Requirements.Compliance with Laws: Vendor shall comply fully with all laws, ordinances, rules, regulations, and orders of any public authority.
Legal and Compliance Requirements.Non-Participation: Successful Proposer shall not participate as a proposer, bidder, or subcontractor on any bids or RFPs related to the projects contemplated by this RFP.

Ownership of Submittal.Ownership: All proposals submitted become the property of the District upon submission.

Subcontractor Utilization.requirements: Prime contractors must use Form A to list MBE/WBE subcontractors and their respective contract amounts.

Proposal Withdrawal.period: Proposals cannot be withdrawn for 60 days after the proposal deadline.
